verses.kjv: And it came to pass in those days, when there was no king in Israel, that there was a certain Levite sojourning on the side of mount Ephraim, who took to him a concubine out of Bethlehemjudah.
verses.ct: During that time, when Israel had no king, a Levite living in the remote hill country of Ephraim took a secondary wife from Bethlehem in Judah.

verses.kjv: And his concubine played the whore against him, and went away from him unto her father’s house to Bethlehemjudah, and was there four whole months.
verses.ct: But his secondary wife was unfaithful to him. She left him and went back to her father's house in Bethlehem in Judah, and she stayed there for 4 months.

verses.kjv: And her husband arose, and went after her, to speak friendly unto her, and to bring her again, having his servant with him, and a couple of asses: and she brought him into her father’s house: and when the father of the damsel saw him, he rejoiced to meet him.
verses.ct: Her husband set out to go after her, hoping to speak kindly to her and bring her back. He had his servant with him and a pair of donkeys. She brought him into her father's house, and when her father saw him, he was happy to welcome him.

verses.kjv: And his father in law, the damsel’s father, retained him; and he abode with him three days: so they did eat and drink, and lodged there.
verses.ct: His father-in-law, the young woman's father, insisted he stay. So he remained with him for 3 days, and they ate, drank, and spent the nights there.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass on the fourth day, when they arose early in the morning, that he rose up to depart: and the damsel’s father said unto his son in law, Comfort thine heart with a morsel of bread, and afterward go your way.
verses.ct: On the 4th day, they got up early in the morning, and the Levite prepared to leave. But the young woman's father said to his son-in-law, "Have something to eat first to keep your strength up, and then you can go."

verses.kjv: And they sat down, and did eat and drink both of them together: for the damsel’s father had said unto the man, Be content, I pray thee, and tarry all night, and let thine heart be merry.
verses.ct: So the two of them sat down and ate and drank together. The young woman's father said to the man, "Please, stay another night and enjoy yourself."

verses.kjv: And when the man rose up to depart, his father in law urged him: therefore he lodged there again.
verses.ct: When the man got up to leave, his father-in-law urged him to stay, so he spent another night there.

verses.kjv: And he arose early in the morning on the fifth day to depart: and the damsel’s father said, Comfort thine heart, I pray thee. And they tarried until afternoon, and they did eat both of them.
verses.ct: On the morning of the 5th day, he got up early to leave, but the young woman's father said, "Please, have something to eat first." So they waited until the afternoon, and the two of them ate together.

verses.kjv: And when the man rose up to depart, he, and his concubine, and his servant, his father in law, the damsel’s father, said unto him, Behold, now the day draweth toward evening, I pray you tarry all night: behold, the day groweth to an end, lodge here, that thine heart may be merry; and to morrow get you early on your way, that thou mayest go home.
verses.ct: When the man got up to leave with his secondary wife and his servant, his father-in-law, the young woman's father, said to him, "Look, the day is almost over and evening is coming. Please stay the night. The day is nearly done — spend the night here and enjoy yourself. Then tomorrow you can get an early start and head home."

verses.kjv: But the man would not tarry that night, but he rose up and departed, and came over against Jebus, which is Jerusalem; and there were with him two asses saddled, his concubine also was with him.
verses.ct: But the man refused to stay another night. He got up and left, traveling as far as the area near Jebus (which is Jerusalem), with his 2 saddled donkeys and his secondary wife.

verses.kjv: And when they were by Jebus, the day was far spent; and the servant said unto his master, Come, I pray thee, and let us turn in into this city of the Jebusites, and lodge in it.
verses.ct: When they were near Jebus and the day was almost gone, the servant said to his master, "Let's stop and go into this city of the Jebusites and spend the night here."

verses.kjv: And his master said unto him, We will not turn aside hither into the city of a stranger, that is not of the children of Israel; we will pass over to Gibeah.
verses.ct: But his master replied, "No, we won't turn aside into a foreign city where none of the people of Israel live. We'll continue on to Gibeah."

verses.kjv: And he said unto his servant, Come, and let us draw near to one of these places to lodge all night, in Gibeah, or in Ramah.
verses.ct: Then he said to his servant, "Come on, let's try to reach one of these towns to spend the night — either Gibeah or Ramah."

verses.kjv: And they passed on and went their way; and the sun went down upon them when they were by Gibeah, which belongeth to Benjamin.
verses.ct: So they kept going, and the sun set on them as they were near Gibeah, which belongs to the tribe of Benjamin.

verses.kjv: And they turned aside thither, to go in and to lodge in Gibeah: and when he went in, he sat him down in a street of the city: for there was no man that took them into his house to lodging.
verses.ct: They turned off the road to spend the night in Gibeah. The man went in and sat down in the town square, but no one offered to take them in for the night.

verses.kjv: And, behold, there came an old man from his work out of the field at even, which was also of mount Ephraim; and he sojourned in Gibeah: but the men of the place were Benjamites.
verses.ct: Then an old man came in from working in the fields that evening. He was originally from the hill country of Ephraim but was living in Gibeah, where the local people were Benjaminites.

verses.kjv: And when he had lifted up his eyes, he saw a wayfaring man in the street of the city: and the old man said, Whither goest thou? and whence comest thou?
verses.ct: He looked up and noticed the traveler sitting in the town square. The old man asked, "Where are you headed? And where are you coming from?"

verses.kjv: And he said unto him, We are passing from Bethlehemjudah toward the side of mount Ephraim; from thence am I: and I went to Bethlehemjudah, but I am now going to the house of the LORD; and there is no man that receiveth me to house.
verses.ct: The Levite answered, "We're traveling from Bethlehem in Judah back to the remote hill country of Ephraim, where I'm from. I went to Bethlehem in Judah, and now I'm making my way to the house of the LORD, but no one has offered to take us in.

verses.kjv: Yet there is both straw and provender for our asses; and there is bread and wine also for me, and for thy handmaid, and for the young man which is with thy servants: there is no want of any thing.
verses.ct: "We have straw and feed for our donkeys, and bread and wine for me, your female servant, and the young man traveling with us. We don't need anything."

verses.kjv: And the old man said, Peace be with thee; howsoever let all thy wants lie upon me; only lodge not in the street.
verses.ct: The old man said, "You're welcome in my home! Let me take care of whatever you need. Just don't spend the night out here in the square."

verses.kjv: So he brought him into his house, and gave provender unto the asses: and they washed their feet, and did eat and drink.
verses.ct: So he brought them to his house and fed the donkeys. They washed their feet and then ate and drank.

verses.kjv: Now as they were making their hearts merry, behold, the men of the city, certain sons of Belial, beset the house round about, and beat at the door, and spake to the master of the house, the old man, saying, Bring forth the man that came into thine house, that we may know him.
verses.ct: While they were enjoying themselves, suddenly some worthless men from the city surrounded the house and started pounding on the door. They called out to the old man who owned the house, "Send out the man who came to your house so we can have sex with him!"

verses.kjv: And the man, the master of the house, went out unto them, and said unto them, Nay, my brethren, nay, I pray you, do not so wickedly; seeing that this man is come into mine house, do not this folly.
verses.ct: The owner of the house went outside to them and said, "No, my brothers, please don't do something so evil! This man is a guest in my house. Don't commit this outrage.

verses.kjv: Behold, here is my daughter a maiden, and his concubine; them I will bring out now, and humble ye them, and do with them what seemeth good unto you: but unto this man do not so vile a thing.
verses.ct: "Look, here is my virgin daughter and his secondary wife. Let me bring them out to you instead. Do whatever you want with them, but don't do this vile thing to this man."

verses.kjv: But the men would not hearken to him: so the man took his concubine, and brought her forth unto them; and they knew her, and abused her all the night until the morning: and when the day began to spring, they let her go.
verses.ct: But the men refused to listen to him. So the Levite grabbed his secondary wife and pushed her outside to them. They raped her and abused her throughout the entire night until morning. When dawn began to break, they finally let her go.

verses.kjv: Then came the woman in the dawning of the day, and fell down at the door of the man’s house where her lord was, till it was light.
verses.ct: At daybreak, the woman made her way back and collapsed at the doorway of the house where her husband was staying. She lay there until it was fully light.

verses.kjv: And her lord rose up in the morning, and opened the doors of the house, and went out to go his way: and, behold, the woman his concubine was fallen down at the door of the house, and her hands were upon the threshold.
verses.ct: Her husband got up in the morning, opened the doors of the house, and stepped out to continue his journey. There was his secondary wife, collapsed at the doorway of the house with her hands on the threshold.

verses.kjv: And he said unto her, Up, and let us be going. But none answered. Then the man took her up upon an ass, and the man rose up, and gat him unto his place.
verses.ct: He said to her, "Get up. Let's go." But there was no answer. So the man lifted her onto the donkey and set out for home.

verses.kjv: And when he was come into his house, he took a knife, and laid hold on his concubine, and divided her, together with her bones, into twelve pieces, and sent her into all the coasts of Israel.
verses.ct: When he arrived at his house, he took a knife, and he cut his secondary wife's body — limbs and bones — into 12 pieces and sent them throughout every region of Israel.

verses.kjv: And it was so, that all that saw it said, There was no such deed done nor seen from the day that the children of Israel came up out of the land of Egypt unto this day: consider of it, take advice, and speak your minds.
verses.ct: Everyone who saw it said, "Nothing like this has ever happened or been seen since the day the people of Israel came out of Egypt until now. Think about it! Discuss it! Then say what should be done!"
